summary: The activity.Context.sleep method should accept time duration as a string (e.g., '1s', '100ms') in addition to milliseconds, similar to the existing behavior in issue #270.
userImpact: Users must convert time durations to milliseconds manually instead of using convenient string formats like other Temporal APIs.
rootCause: The sleep method only accepts numeric milliseconds, inconsistent with other Temporal SDK methods that support duration strings.
proposedFix: Accept duration strings (e.g., '1s', '100ms') as an alternative to numeric milliseconds in activity.Context.sleep.
resolutionDetails: Issue was addressed to align activity.Context.sleep API with other Temporal SDK methods for consistency.
keyQuote: this should take a string too
